articles.title: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's Afcon triumph
articles.summary: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations after the final is overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play.

articles.title: Diaz will 'have nightmares' over 'Panenka' failure
articles.summary: Brahim Diaz had the chance to win Afcon for Morocco, but his choice to try a Panenka ended up costing his side dearly as Senegal hit back to win the game in extra time.

articles.title: Everton disallowed goal frustrating but right decision - Hart
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Joe Hart says Everton players and fans are right to be "frustrated" by their disallowed goal against Aston Villa, it was the correct decision.

articles.title: Will Frank and Glasner see the season out?
articles.summary: Match of the Day's Kelly Cates, Joe Hart and Ellen White discuss whether it is possible for Tottenham manager Thomas Frank and Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner to remain at their clubs until the end...

articles.title: Arsenal & Chelsea overtake Barcelona in women's money league
articles.summary: Arsenal and Chelsea leapfrog Barcelona to post highest revenue growth in European football after successful 2025.

articles.title: Frank expected to take charge of Spurs against Dortmund
articles.summary: Thomas Frank is expected to remain in charge of Tottenham for their Champions League fixture against Borussia Dortmund on Tuesday night.

articles.title: Ref Watch LIVE! AFCON chaos and should Dalot have seen red?
'Arsenal will never forgive themselves if they don't win title now'
articles.summary: This is Mikel Arteta and Arsenal's "now or never" moment as Premier League title rivals stumble badly, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

articles.title: 'I'm not so sure I learned much' - O'Neill knows what Celtic need after cup win
articles.summary: Celtic manager Martin O'Neill admits he did not learn much about his squad after a laborious Scottish Cup victory over sixth-tier Auchinleck Talbot.

articles.title: 'An ambassador for African football' - Mane is Senegal's Afcon hero
articles.summary: Senegal forward Sadio Mane is the hero once again, but this time for unexpected reasons as his side leaves the pitch during the chaotic Afcon final win over Morocco.

articles.title: Goals galore in FA Cup as Liverpool, Man Utd & Man City progress
articles.summary: Liverpool, Manchester City and Manchester United all cruise into the fifth round of the Women's FA Cup as 55 goals are scored across 12 matches on Sunday.

articles.title: Barry secures deserved win for Everton against Villa
articles.summary: Everton's Thierno Barry capitalises on a mistake by Aston Villa's Emi Martinez for a 1-0 win to The Toffees, which stops Villa going second in the Premier League.

articles.title: Newcastle miss out on top-five spot in draw with Wolves
articles.summary: Wolves held Newcastle United to a goalless draw to prevent Eddie Howe's side from climbing into the top five of the Premier League table.

articles.title: Everton win over Villa 'incredibly satisfying' - Moyes
articles.summary: Everton manager David Moyes says his side's performance against Aston Villa was "incredibly satisfying" as they won 1-0 at Villa Park.

articles.title: Results, fans, fall-outs - factors that lead to managerial pressure
articles.summary: From bad results to a clash with a club's owners - BBC Sport takes a look at some of the factors that lead to managers coming under pressure.

articles.title: Red cards, VAR and offside laws facing Ifab review
articles.summary: The Ifab's annual business meeting in London will discuss changes to the laws for the Fifa World Cup and domestic leagues.
